title: U.S. students who have used hallucinogenic drugs 2017
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
In Sex Male, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 among the 4 groups and in Female, Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students 14.0.
Among all the Sexs, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 in Sex Male and lowest value 58.0 in Sex Female.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 24.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Hispanic.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
In Sex Male, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 among the 4 groups and in Female, Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students 14.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
In Sex Male, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 among the 4 groups and in Female, Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students 14.0.
Among all the Sexs, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 in Sex Male and lowest value 58.0 in Sex Female.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 24.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Hispanic.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
Sex Male had the maximum Share of students among all 4 groups, and it was for Hispanic. The minimum Share of students was observed in Sex Female for Black (non-Hispanic).
Among all the Sexs, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 in Sex Male and lowest value 58.0 in Sex Female.
The maximum Share of students for Hispanic that was found in Sex Male was 1.41 times larger than the minimum Share of students observed in Sex Female.
Among the groups, Black (non-Hispanic) had the biggest difference in Share of students. Where the maximum Share of students was 3.43 times larger than the minimum Share of students.
Hispanic had the maximum Share of students out of all 4 groups in Sex Male followed by Hispanic in Male, and the minimum Share of students is found for Black (non-Hispanic) in Female.

On average, the Sex Male had the highest Share of students for all 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. Whereas Female had the lowest average Share of students.
